page.title: 13Places Of Interest.
page.content:
BANK HALL - Now a local private residence, had once a secret room used as a chapel in the days when Masses were said in secret. It was vaguely rumoured that treasure was hidden in a field near Bank Hall. Priests at this time often hid candlesticks and chalices to keep them safe.
BROUGHTON SCHOOL - Built 1843. Children paid 3p if over 11, 2p if over 8, 1p if under 8. In 1953 the school was changed from all age to Junior and Infant.
TOLLBAR COTTAGE - Broughton. Private residence. It projects into the road. It was here that a moveable wooden turnpike was erected. The government listed the A6 a turnpike road in 1760.
